intro: Scleranthus mollis, commonly known as soft thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its seeds are small and often dispersed by wind. Scleranthus mollis is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along the edges of water bodies.
